thread.title: Former Newcastle United footballer John Barnes rejects claim that he supports Leave campaign
thread.title_full: Former Newcastle United footballer John Barnes rejects claim that he supports Leave campaign

author: Sonia Sharma
title: Former Newcastle United footballer John Barnes rejects claim that he supports Leave campaign
text:
Former Newcastle United footballer John Barnes rejects claim that he supports Leave campaign 15:13, 22 Jun 2016 The ex-England player says his views on the EU referendum were misinterprated and he supports Remain Shares The video will start in 8 s Cancel Click to play Tap to play The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video 
Former Newcastle United footballer John Barnes has hit out at EU Leave campaigner Michael Gove for labelling him a Brexit supporter . 
The Justice Secretary had claimed on Tuesday morning that the ex England player supported an exit from the European Union . 
But Barnes has now said his views had been “misinterpreted” after he said in an interview that Brexit would be good for English footballers . 
He said: “How this happened was I gave an interview stating that for English football it would be better off being out of the EU because, of course, we couldn’t get all of these European players coming in as easily, so it would be better for English footballers. 
“That was then misinterpreted as I’m supporting the Leave campaign. 
“I got a call the very next day, this is about a month ago, saying ‘oh thank you very much for your support’ - and I made it categorically clear that speaking from the point of view of English footballers, it would be better off, but I don’t support the Leave campaign because that’s a very selfish view of me looking just at English football. 
“I’ve got to think about what I think is right for the country. I made it plain that I do not support them, I support Remain.”
